controls.title: Ensure NFS is not installed
controls.description: The Network File System (NFS) is one of the first and most widely distributed file systems in the UNIX environment.
controls.rationale: If the system does not export NFS shares, it is recommended that the NFS be disabled to reduce the remote attack surface.
controls.audit:
Run the following command to verify nfs-utils is not installed:
# rpm -q nfs-utils
package nfs-utils is not installed
controls.remediation:
Run the following command to remove nfs-utils:
# dnf remove nfs-utils
controls.references: 1. More information on NFS is available at https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_enterprise_linux/8/

controls.title: Ensure rpcbind is not installed
controls.description: The rpcbind utility maps RPC services to the ports on which they listen.
controls.rationale: If the system does not require rpc based services, it is recommended that rpcbind be removed to reduce the remote attack surface.
controls.audit:
Run the following command to verify rpcbind is not installed:
# rpm -q rpcbind
package rpcbind is not installed
controls.remediation:
Run the following command to remove rpcbind:
# dnf remove rpcbind
controls.references: 1. More information on rpcbind is available at https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_enterprise_linux/8/

controls.title: Ensure rsync is not installed
controls.description: The rsync service can be used to synchronize files between systems over network links.
controls.rationale: The rsync service presents a security risk as it uses unencrypted protocols for communication.
controls.audit:
Run the following command to verify rsync is not installed:
# rpm -q rsync
package rsync is not installed
controls.remediation:
Run the following command to remove rsync:
# dnf remove rsync
controls.references: 1. More information on rsync is available at https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-us/red_hat_enterprise_linux/8/
